title: Investigation of Zero-shot Text-to-Speech Models for Enhancing Short-Utterance Speaker Verification
author: Yiyang Zhao (Tsinghua University), Shuai Wang (Chinese University of Hong Kong), Guangzhi Sun (University of Cambridge), Zehua Chen (Tsinghua University), Chao Zhang (Tsinghua University), Mingxing Xu (Tsinghua University), Thomas Fang Zheng (Tsinghua University), ...
relevance_why: The paper explores the application of zero-shot text-to-speech (ZS-TTS) systems in enhancing speaker verification, which aligns closely with my interest in using machine learning techniques in audio processing and generation.
background: Enhancing speaker verification accuracy by using synthesized speech from zero-shot text-to-speech models during test time, particularly for short utterances.
contribution: This paper introduces the use of zero-shot text-to-speech systems for test-time data augmentation in speaker verification, demonstrating significant improvements in short-utterance verification performance.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing research primarily focuses on synthesizing additional training data to improve speaker models but doesn't leverage TTS systems for test-time augmentation.
technical_comparison.novelty: The proposed method utilizes state-of-the-art TTS models for generating synthetic speech at test time without modifying the original speaker models, leading to improved accuracy.

key_innovation: It systematically investigates and demonstrates how TTS-generated speech can enhance speaker recognition in scenarios with very limited data, particularly for short utterances.
real_world_impact: The findings may significantly improve speaker verification applications in settings with limited audio data, such as security and biometrics, enhancing user authentication processes.
limitations: The paper notes that the improvements are limited due to TTS models' inconsistencies with short prompts, and longer synthetic speech does not equate to advantages seen with longer real speech.

new_terms.zero-shot text-to-speech (ZS-TTS): **Zero-shot text-to-speech (ZS-TTS)** refers to TTS systems capable of synthesizing speech in a voice that they have not been explicitly trained on by using only a short audio prompt.
new_terms.equal error rate (EER): **Equal error rate (EER)** is a common metric in speaker verification that indicates the point at which the false acceptance rate and false rejection rate are equal.
